title: RN-Home Care Nurse-Full Time/Part Time
company: Parker Jewish Institute for Health Care and Rehabilitation
description:
**Home Care RN**

**Certified Home Health Agency**

 *Full Time and Part Time positions available!*

  

Parker Jewish Institute Hospice and Home Health Care is seeking **Full Time and Part Time Community Registered Nurses** to join Parker's Certified Home Health Agency (CHHA).


Parker Jewish Institute Hospice and Home Health Care offers the finest in home health and hospice services from an interdisciplinary team of health care professionals. Parker Jewish Institute for Health Care and Rehabilitation is a faith-based, not-for-profit health care system comprised of multiple health services servicing the Metropolitan New York Area, including Long Island, Brooklyn, Queens, Bronx, Manhattan and Westchester.


The Home Care RN at Parker Jewish Institute's Certified Home Health Agency is responsible for establishing standards of care for patients, providing nursing service in the patient's home, assuring compliance based on current regulations, and promoting community health through teaching, counseling and providing direct patient care.


This position requires the full understanding and the active participation in fulfilling the mission of Parker Hospice and Home Care-to deliver exceptional care and to enhance the quality of life of our patients.

 **About Parker**


The Parker Jewish Institute for Health Care and Rehabilitation, conveniently located on the Queens-Nassau County border in New Hyde Park, New York, is a non-profit health care facility that offers inpatient programs such as sub-acute/short term rehabilitation, long-term care and nursing home care, as well as community health services encompassing certified home health care and a comprehensive community hospice program that serves terminally ill patients in their own homes or in nursing facilities, including Parker's nursing home.


Quality care means hiring quality people, and Parker Jewish Institute for Health Care and Rehabilitation has a longstanding reputation for excellence and innovation in resident and patient care.

 **Why Work at Parker**

* Friendly, collaborative team environment and exciting career growth opportunities providing an opportunity to learn, grow and have an impact on the overall results
* Excellent training and clinical education
* Accessible via public transportation
* Free parking on site for all staff
* On-site cafeteria offering breakfast and lunch
* Full Benefits for Full Time and Part Time staff include Health Insurance, 401k, Vacation, Holiday and Sick Time

 **Position Qualifications**

* Current New York State RN license
* Prior Community RN or Home Health RN experience is a plus
* Access to reliable transportation a must-available to travel within Queens and Nassau Counties
* Tech savvy, with proficiency in AllScripts or another electronic medical record (EMR)
* Fully vaccinated against COVID-19

The Admissions RN works closely with the intake team, referring physician and other referral sources to promote the CHHA philosophy of care. Assessments may take place in private homes, hospitals or nursing facilities.

description:
**Primary Care Provider**


Parker At Your Door, a medical house calls program serving the greater New York Metro region, is seeking a **Primary Care NP** to provide quality primary medical care to our patients in the comfort of their homes.


*Now Conducting Visits in Suffolk County*

*Full Time, Part Time and Per Visit Opportunities Available!*

 **Position Overview**


As a Primary Care Provider, you will be responsible for assessing members with multiple comorbidities residing in the community. In this position, you will perform comprehensive evaluation of patients and provide medical management.


This position is a key clinical role within a growing community program, with the ability to make an impact and offers a significant personal and professional opportunity to join a world-renowned health care organization. We offer competitive pay rates, free parking, flexible scheduling and more.

 **About Parker**


The Parker Jewish Institute for Health Care and Rehabilitation, conveniently located on the Queens-Nassau County border in New Hyde Park, New York, is a non-profit health care facility that offers inpatient programs such as sub-acute/short term rehabilitation, long-term care and nursing home care, as well as community health services encompassing certified home health care and a comprehensive community hospice program that serves terminally ill patients in their own homes or in nursing facilities, including Parker's nursing home.


Quality care means hiring quality people, and Parker Jewish Institute for Health Care and Rehabilitation has a longstanding reputation for excellence and innovation in resident and patient care.

 **Why Work at Parker**

* Friendly, collaborative team environment and exciting career growth opportunities providing an opportunity to learn, grow and have an impact on the overall results
* Excellent training and clinical education
* Accessible via public transportation
* Free parking on site for all staff
* On-site cafeteria offering breakfast and lunch
* Full Benefits for Full Time and Part Time staff include Health Insurance, 401k, Vacation, Holiday and Sick Time

 **Responsibilities Include**

* Examine patients and order appropriate diagnostic workups
* Assess members with acute change in condition in a timely manner
* Maintains complete and accurate medical records
* Consults with other members of the interdisciplinary team to create appropriate and viable care plan
* Educate patients in topics such as disease process, medication and compliance
* Medical management of patients

 **Position Qualifications**

* Licensure and current registration to practice as a NP in New York State
* Strong communication and follow up skills
* Knowledge of Microsoft including excel, knowledge of data entry, documentation and report generation
* Prior experience with the geriatric population and home care strongly preferred
* Knowledge of medical documentation
* Fully Vaccinated against COVID-19

title: Program Director-Nursing Workforce Transformation Program
company: Parker Jewish Institute for Health Care and Rehabilitation
description:
**Program Director-Full Time**


Nursing Workforce Transformation Program

  

Parker's Superior Health Care Community of Practice (SHCCP) is an innovative clinical program that will train diverse Certified Nursing Assistants (CNAs), Licensed Practical Nurses (LPNs), and Registered Nurses (RNs) to meet Parker's mission which is " to provide with compassion and dedication, superior quality health care and rehabilitation for adults." With this overarching idea, the project will be framed by a "community of practice" model, in which cohort members interact regularly to learn professional practices, become socialized into the culture of person-centered care, and come to see themselves as valuable, empowered community members who belong in healthcare. Supported by culturally and linguistically diverse staff/mentors, individual trainees become connected to the larger social order of the healthcare community. Access to professional/social networks give them knowledge, values, beliefs, and attitudes that are conducive to their professional empowerment and success; they contribute their own sociocultural and linguistic richness.


The result will be improved quality of care, professional and economic growth for the employees, a stronger long term care workforce capable of meeting current and future demands, and increased capacity to train a diverse workforce.


For this program, we are seeking a full time **Program Director,** who will be responsible for overseeing the recruitment and training elements delivered through the community of practice model, including the development of materials that are inclusive for diverse populations, advertising campaigns, liaising with contractors and community members, and data gathering.

 **About Parker**


The Parker Jewish Institute for Health Care and Rehabilitation, conveniently located on the Queens-Nassau County border in New Hyde Park, New York, is a non-profit health care facility that offers inpatient programs such as sub-acute/short term rehabilitation, long-term care and nursing home care, as well as community health services encompassing certified home health care and a comprehensive community hospice program that serves terminally ill patients in their own homes or in nursing facilities, including Parker's nursing home.

title: Outside Sales Representative / Restaurant Specialist
description:
**Hospitality Specialist**
==========================



At SpotOn, we help restaurants and small businesses compete and win with flexible payment and software technology backed by real people who really care. Every SpotOn tool, from seamless point-of-sale systems to integrated restaurant management solutions, is designed to help local businesses increase profits and create better experiences for their customers and employees.



Recently, SpotOn was:


* Named one of Fast Company's Most Innovative Companies of 2024
* Awarded Great Places to Work and Built In's Best Workplaces for the third year in a row
* Selected as the Best Overall Restaurant POS by NerdWallet
* Rated the top-rated point-of-sale (POS) for restaurants, bars, retail, and small businesses by Capterra users


We're committed to caring hard and moving fast so that we can continue to grow and make a positive impact together.



That's where you come in.



As a Hospitality Specialist, you will be working in your local assigned territory and responsible for promoting our full product suite while building positive relationships with local businesses & restaurant owners to help take their businesses to the next level. We're looking for motivated individuals with an entrepreneurial spirit who excel at developing new relationships, deeply understand SMB's biggest challenges, and have the drive to make a significant impact in their local communities.


**Responsibilities:**


* Be a local representative for SpotOn in your community by offering advanced technology to local business owners that will help run and grow their businesses
* Travel to and from client sites within a designated geographical territory to prospect, build relationships, and sign up new local business owners and merchants
* Manage the full sales cycle from start to finish with a growing portfolio of clients
* Hit sales targets, with a particular focus on selling software & point-of-sale solutions along with payment processing
* Work closely with our extended Sales Support team to help reach your monthly sales performance goals


**Qualifications:**



Research shows that women and members of underrepresented groups tend to apply to roles only when they check every box on a job description. We encourage you to apply if you meet the majority of our qualifications and if this role is aligned with your career trajectory.


* 2+ years of B2B sales experience with an emphasis on small business owners, merchants, and restaurants
* Proven track record delivering against sales goals with a metrics-oriented, need-to-win attitude
* Excellent cold calling, prospecting, and territory buildout experience
* Proficient in Salesforce as a CRM is a plus
* Maintain and manage the client relationship in collaboration with our internal support teams to ensure the success & satisfaction of your customer portfolio
* The ability to learn technology basics and apply them to business situations
* Ability to embrace feedback and hold yourself accountable


**Benefits:**



At SpotOn, we put people above everything else. We're known for our innovative software and technology solutions, but we stand out because of the hard-working humans behind the tech. We can't take care of our clients without taking care of our employees first, and that's why we invest in you with a competitive benefits package which includes:


* Medical, Dental, and Vision Insurance
* 401k with company match
* RSUs
* Paid vacation, 10 company holidays, sick time, and volunteer time off
* Employee Resource Groups to build community and inclusion at work
* Monthly cell phone and internet stipend
* Tuition reimbursement for up to $2,000 per calendar year to assist with your professional development


* These represent our full-time benefits. Part-time/hourly benefits may vary and will be shared upon request


**Compensation:**


* Base salary of $60,000 for this role.
* Please note the salary range listed is just one component of a competitive compensation package which includes a company stock plan
* Commissions will be paid daily for new accounts signed, bonuses earned for hardware and implementation, monthly production bonuses, and customer retention.
* Offers will be reflective of the candidate's location and experience.


*SpotOn is an equal employment opportunity employer. Qualified candidates are considered for employment without regard to race, religion, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, age, military or veteran status, disability, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.*



#LI-HYBRID


SpotOn is an e-verify company.

title: Assistant Research Scientist
description:
**Job Title:** Assistant Research Scientist

**Grade:** 15

**Salary:** $55,652.00 - $66,648


The Research Foundation for Mental Hygiene, Inc. (RFMH) is currently seeking a qualified candidate to fill an Assistant Research Scientist position at the Neuroscience Laboratory at the New York State Psychiatric Institute. The laboratory uses rodent preparations to model mechanisms and treatment targets in mental illness. Study of the circuit mechanisms of normal brain functions and how early life experiences and exposures change them is a focus.


Experience with procedures and data analysis utilizing genetically encoded biosensors and in vivo physiology is desirable. Proficiency with in vivo viral-mediated gene transfer, optogenetics, and chemogenetics is essential. Familiarity with programming in Matlab and Python is also important.


The incumbent must be able to work a flexible schedule, including some weekends and evenings. The incumbent must possess strong organizational skills and the ability to maintain detailed records.

**Duties and Responsibilities:**


Research will focus on neurobehavioral systems, employing environmental and molecular/genetic manipulations to explore neural cellular and circuit functions, ultimately linking them to behavior. Depending on the experiment's requirements, research responsibilities will involve various combinations of:

* Handling research rodents
* Performing stereotaxic surgery and monitoring recovery
* Conducting behavioral testing
* Performing anatomical circuit tracing and neurohistology
* Carrying out electrophysiological and biosensor recordings
* Data analysis

**Minimum Qualifications:**

* Bachelor's degree and one year of professional research experience in an appropriate field or 30 graduate hours leading to an advanced degree in an appropriate field may be substituted for the required experience.
* At least two years of experience using Matlab and Python.

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* Recently completed a Ph.D. or equivalent in a neuroscience-related field withing the last 3 years
* At least 2 years of experience with a minimum of 3 of the following techniques: stereotaxic surgery, behavioral testing, anatomical circuit tracing, neurohistology, electrophysiology, biosensor recordings, and data analysis.
* Demonstrated experience in assisting lab members with data collection, analysis, or troubleshooting.

**Work Location:** 1051 Riverside Drive, New York, NY 10032

**To Apply:** Submit an application through our website at https://nyspi.applicantpro.com/jobs/. Please note only applications submitted through our website will be considered.


The Mission of the Research Foundation for Mental Hygiene, Inc. (RFMH) is to promote the mental health of all New Yorkers, with a focus on providing hope and supporting recovery for adults with serious mental illness and children with serious emotional disturbances. Applicants with lived mental health experience are encouraged to apply. RFMH is deeply committed to supporting underserved individuals, organizations, and communities. To this end, RFMH is focused on implementing activities and initiatives to reduce disparities in access, quality, and treatment outcomes for underserved populations. A critical component of these efforts is ensuring that RFMH is a diverse and inclusive workplace where all employees' unique attributes and skills are valued and utilized to support the mission of the Agency. RFMH is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer.


The Research Foundation is a private not-for-profit corporation and is not an agency or instrumentality of the State of New York. Employees of the Research Foundation are not state employees, do not participate in any state retirement system, and do not receive state fringe benefits. Excellent Benefits Package. Employer/Minority/Women/Disabled/Veteran Employer. VEVRAA 41 CFR 60-300.5(a) compliant.

title: Coaching and Training Specialist
description:
**Job Title:** Coaching & Training Specialist

**Grade:** 22

**Salary:** $75,999 - $81,294


The Research Foundation for Mental Hygiene, Inc. (RFMH) is currently seeking a qualified candidate to serve as a Coaching & Training Specialist. The incumbent will provide coaching, training, and technical assistance support to implement High Fidelity Wraparound (HFW) and other identified training topics for the benefit of children and their families statewide. This position will be in various locations throughout the state. This position is within I CONECT at the Center for Practice Innovations (CPI) and receives oversight and guidance from the NYS OMH Division of Integrated Community Services for Children and Families.


Under the auspices of the New York State Office of Mental Health (OMH), the Center for Practice Innovations (CPI) promotes the widespread use of evidence-based practices within behavioral health provider agencies throughout New York State. Considered an "Intermediary Organization" for implementation, CPI uses innovative approaches to build stakeholder collaborations, develop and maintain practitioners' expertise, and build agency infrastructures that support implementing and sustaining evidence-based practices. CPI also works with OMH to identify and involve program participants, families, providers, and scientific/academic organizations as partners in supporting the goals of OMH and CPI.


I CONECT is located at the Center for Practice Innovations (CPI), in the New York State Psychiatric Institute. The mission of the institute is to establish ongoing engagement, ensure integrated care, identify best practices, share core competencies, provide information, and create training opportunities that include cultural humility, person-centeredness, recovery, and trauma informed approaches for care managers throughout New York State.


The chosen candidate must possess the ability to work independently and as part of a team.


This position is fully remote. The incumbent must reside in New York State or the New York City metro area.

**Duties and Responsibilities:**

* The facilitation of individual or small group coaching, training and technical assistance sessions with provider teams as directed by the Statewide Coordinator.
* Creating a learning environment that is youth and family centered, creative, and advances diversity, equity, inclusion, belonging, and justice.
* Accurate delivery and facilitation of training curricula for large groups through trainer led virtual or in classroom sessions.
* Supporting training curriculum using asynchronous platforms.
* Utilizing state-approved tools to measure program fidelity and youth/family satisfaction.
* Observing practice implementation in the field to assess for adherence to fidelity and quality standards.
* Analyzing data from fidelity tools and observations to identify individual and group coaching opportunities.
* Partnering with providers to create and monitor individual skill development plans.
* Supporting the Statewide Coordinator in conducting ongoing needs assessments. Making recommendations to adjust training curriculum accordingly.
* Participating in the revision and/or creation of training, coaching, technical assistance, and marketing material.
* Supporting the development of pre- and post-evaluations surveys and questionnaires for ongoing data collection.
* Maintaining records regarding training, coaching and technical assistance attendance.
* Development and compilation of required reports.
* Assuring cultural awareness and sensitivity of programs delivered.
* Traveling throughout NYS to attend/facilitate on-site meetings, trainings, coaching and technical assistance sessions as needed.

**Minimum Qualifications:**

* A bachelor's degree or higher from an accredited college or university in the fields of education, public health, social services, psychology, sociology, or human services program management AND two (2) years of experience in care management or a related field.
* A Master's Degree in any of the fields listed above may be substituted for two-years of experience in care management.
* Personal lived and living experience of mental health and/or substance recovery can substitute for education.
* At least two years of experience facilitating training/workshops and providing coaching or technical assistance preferably in a human service setting.
* At least one year using standard office professional software packages and web-based applications including Zoom, Webex, Share Point, Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, web-based training and learning management systems.
* A valid NYS driver's license is required. Must be able to participate in overnight, statewide travel as needed

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* Preference will be given to candidates that have supervised or implemented High Fidelity Wraparound using the NYS model.

**Work Location:** Fully remote, or, 1051 Riverside Drive, New York, NY 10032

**To Apply:** Submit an application through our website at https://nyspi.applicantpro.com/jobs/. Please note only applications submitted through our website will be considered.


The Mission of the Research Foundation for Mental Hygiene, Inc. (RFMH) is to promote the mental health of all New Yorkers, with a focus on providing hope and supporting recovery for adults with serious mental illness and children with serious emotional disturbances. Applicants with lived mental health experience are encouraged to apply. RFMH is deeply committed to supporting underserved individuals, organizations, and communities. title: Strength and Conditioning Coach
description:
BSE Global ("BSE") is a multifaceted sports and entertainment business that brings people together to experience music, sports, and culture through our teams and venue. Through these experiences and in our workplace, we strive to elevate our business, grow our fan base, and cultivate a community anchored in belonging and inclusion in every aspect, on and off the court.

  


**Long Island Nets' Mission Statement****:**  

"To replicate the Brooklyn Nets atmosphere and core principals in order to establish an environment that fosters growth and development in both our players and staff"


**Organizational Goals**


* Prioritize development of our BKN players on assignment, Two-Way players, and staff, both on and off the court, so they are prepared to contribute in the NBA
* Instill Brooklyn Nets culture. Hold players and staff accountable to a standard of high character, hard work, and competitiveness.
* Be ambitious and innovative. Try out new methods to expand our collective knowledge. Establish proof-of-concept before deploying the best ideas in Brooklyn.

  


**SUMMARY:**



The Head Strength and Conditioning Coach is critical part of the LI Nets; Performance Team and form part of the wider Brooklyn Nets Performance Department. He/she/they shall be subject to the direction and supervision of the Long Island Nets' General Manager or such other person(s) as may be designated by the Club with respect to the duties and responsibilities described and such additional duties and responsibilities as may be assigned to the Head Strength & Conditioning Coach. The Strength and Conditioning Coach shall perform all required duties and responsibilities in a manner satisfactory to the Long Island Nets' General Manager.


**PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES:**


* Development of all player's physical strength and conditioning capabilities, through both team and individual programs.
* Strength and conditioning session scheduling / periodization.
* Setting and evaluation of player's individual physical K.P.I.'s.
* Preparation of players for training and games with on-court warm ups at the coaches' discretion.
* Recording of all player's strength and conditioning programs in the team's database.
* Assist in the implementation of a data driven and evidence based Sport Science / Strength and Conditioning program,
* Work across protocols for Return to Training, Return to Participation and Return to Performance.
* Develop and review team protocols focused on travel and sleep strategies – including specific details on responsibilities for implementation.
* Ensure the cleanliness and upkeep of the training areas and equipment at facilities and when travelling.
* Assist in the implementation of player nutrition strategies and hydration on game day.
* Manage projects as assigned by the Long Island Nets' General Manager.


**EXTENED/DETAILED TASKS & RESPONSIVILITIES:**


* Development and implementation of extended injury prevention circuits to be utilized pre-training at the coaches' discretion.
* Collecting and distributing information relating to player's weight and body composition and ensuring this is stored on the club database.
* Delivery of player recovery programs.
* Delivery of end stage rehabilitation programs as required under the guidance of the Director of Performance Rehabilitation.
* Delivery of components of player's individual injury prevention programs.
* Assist with ordering all food, and ensuring it is delivered to players or the practice facility at the appropriate times.
* Assist in the implementation of the club's supplementation program (in conjunction with the Sports Scientist) including ensuring all supplements are cleared for use in the NBA, ordering all supplements, ensuring they are delivered to players at the appropriate times and recording on the club database exactly what every player has taken.
* Logging of all relevant data on to the team's online data management system.
* Development and daily maintenance of the team gym.
* Keeping the gym stocked and all equipment updated.
* Order, prepare and distribute players 'Recovery bags' as required.
* Order, prepare and distribute information on travel and recovery strategies to players as required.


**EXPECTED BEHAVIORS**


* **Technically skilled**
	+ High technical ability – Becoming masters in their areas of strength
	+ Creative/Innovative – Able to find new solutions to problems
	+ Attention to Detail – Systematic approach and execute tasks properly without micromanagement
	+ Avid Learners – Able to inwardly and outwardly reflect
	+ Proactive- brings new ideas to the team and does without being told what to do
* **Team Oriented**
	+ Embrace their Role – Understand role/strengths within the team
	+ Receive and Apply Coaching – Able to take feedback and apply it
	+ Improve Team Synergy/Cohesion – Makes a positive influence on team dynamics
	+ Understand Systems, Processes and Tasks – Follows proper procedures
	+ Effective Communicators – Able to be reflective and open
	+ Flexible/Adaptable – able to adjust quickly to new changes
* **High Emotional Intelligence**
	+ Self-Efficacy – achieve goals set through highs and lows
	+ Control/Adapt Emotions – calm and collected, optimistic attitude
	+ Empathetic – being aware of others thoughts, feelings, experiences
	+ Intrinsically Motivated – Motivated from within to achieve outcomes
	+ Honesty/Integrity—does what is right, speaks plainly and truthfully

**SALARY RANGE:** $85,000- $95,000


*We are an Equal Employment Opportunity ("EEO") Employer. It has been and will continue to be a fundamental policy of the Company not to discriminate on the basis of race, color, creed, religion, gender, gender identity, transgender status, pregnancy, marital status, partnership status, domestic violence victim status, sexual orientation, age, national origin, alienage or citizenship status, veteran or military status, disability, genetic information or any other characteristic prohibited by federal, state or local laws.*

title: Executive Administrative Assistant & Office Administrator
description:
**Job Summary**



The Executive Administrative Assistant will provide administrative support to the CIO and Investment team executives. This role will be responsible for the coordination of daily operations in the New York office including visitor management, work orders, deliveries, and administrative support.



This role reports to the Director, Chief of Staff with a secondary reporting connection to the Director, Workplace Services, and will be based out of the New York office.


*This role requires an in-office schedule Monday–Thursday, 8:00 AM–5:00 PM, with remote work permitted on Friday, unless needed in person.*


**Duties and Responsibilities**



Executive Assistant (60%):


* Manages the calendar of the Chief Investment Officer & team VPs as needed, including arranging meetings and coordinating associated domestic and international travel.
* Works closely with the Executive to keep them well informed of upcoming commitments and responsibilities, following up appropriately. Has a sense of challenges, priorities, or issues taking place in the environment and keeps the Executive updated.
* Anticipates the Executive's needs in advance of meetings or upcoming activities.
* Supports the preparation and timely delivery of materials for various internal and external meetings, quarterly earnings calls, as well as questionnaires.
* Plans and organizes meetings, and team events in collaboration with the events planning team; end-to-end, both on-site and off-site. This includes reserving meeting rooms, coordinating travel, and arranging catering, etc.
* Processes letters, memorandums and reports, including some of confidential nature. Prepares PowerPoint presentations, as required.
* Processes site-related invoices, travel and expense reports. Works with the Finance team to proactively resolve issues, as they arise.
* Effectively collaborates with other functional areas & other Executive Assistants to complete tasks and initiatives.
* Serves as the point of contact for the organization on behalf of the CIO


Office Administration (40%):


* Greet & provide customer service to employees, contractors and visitors in the office.
* Oversee visitor coordination and keep an updated internal visitor log.
* Coordinate on-site meetings and events, including arranging facility and meeting supplies, data entry, catering, visitor and guest registration, on-site assistance, etc.
* Ensure proper functioning of audio-video equipment in conference rooms for meetings, and have IT resources on stand-by for any issues.
* Maintain and organize office space including ensuring cleanliness, and stocking office & break areas, and hospitality refrigerators.
* Work with IT to ensure all office equipment and internet services are functional
* Coordinate and submit building work orders into tenant portals for building maintenance, lighting, HVAC, or security.
* Receive incoming mail and deliveries; send outgoing mail via FedEx or USPS
* Maintain awareness of and help promote emergency, security and safety policies


**Experience and Education Requirements**


* High School Diploma required; Bachelor's Degree preferred
* Minimum of 5 years prior experience in executive level administrative support activities
* Minimum of 2 years experience in supporting a multi-person team preferred


**Knowledge, Skills and Abilities**


* Ability to work as part of a team and interact effectively with others
* Has a pleasant and professional demeanor and appearance
* Self-motivator with strong organizational and intra-personal skills
* Highly organized and comfortable working in a fast-paced environment
* Strong attention to detail
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Knowledge of general administrative protocols
* Ability to understand the objectives of work assigned in order to revise/adjust workload and prioritize immediate needs
* Ability to handle confidential information
* Ability to resolve issues with professionalism
* Proficient in Outlook, PowerPoint, Word, and other typical office software applications


**Other Requirements**


* Primarily (80%+) on-site role
* Perform other functions, duties and projects as assigned
* Regular and punctual attendance
* First Aid, CPR & AED certification, preferred or ability to obtain
* Some travel may be required (less than 10%)


*The targeted hourly rate range for this role is $33.50/hr - $48.25/hr. Actual hourly rate may be above or below this range based on factors such as location, skills, relevant experience, operational needs, internal parity and other considerations permitted by law.*


*Certain roles are eligible for additional compensation such as annual bonus. These awards are allocated based on individual and company performance.*


*In addition to competitive pay, we offer our full-time employees the following benefits: medical, dental, vision, a 401(k) plan and company match, short-term and long-term disability coverage, basic life insurance, holidays, personal days, wellness incentives, tuition reimbursement among others. To find out additional details about our competitive benefits package, visit our benefits page on our website:* *https://www.fglife.com/about/careers.html*



#IND-HP

#LI-MK1### **Additional Information**

**Work Environments**



F&G believes in an employee-centric flexible environment, which is why we offer the ability for in-office, hybrid and remote work arrangements. During the hiring process, you'll work with your leader to decide what works best for your role.



F&G complies with federal and state disability laws and makes reasonable accommodations for applicants and candidates with disabilities, unless such accommodation would cause an undue hardship for F&G. If reasonable accommodation is needed to participate in the job application or interview process, please contact talentacquisition@fglife.com.



Join our employee-centric hybrid work environment: F&G Careers

Since 1959, Fidelity & Guaranty Life Insurance Company (F&G) has offered annuity and life insurance products to those who are seeking security in retirement and protection during life's unexpected events.



As a national Top Workplace1, an Iowa Top Workplace2 and a proud equal opportunity employer, F&G team members are empowered, collaborative, dynamic and authentic. description:

title: ABA Behavior Technician
description:
Job Summary:  
Join our team at The Lighthouse, a leading provider of behavioral health services, as a dedicated Behavior Technician. We specialize in offering exceptional care to individuals with developmental disabilities, focusing on promoting skill development and enhancing quality of life. As a Behavior Technician, you will play a crucial role in implementing evidence-based interventions to support individuals in achieving their full potential.

Duties:

- Collaborate with a multidisciplinary team to ensure comprehensive care for individuals.  
- Provide direct support and assistance in implementing behavior intervention strategies.  
- Maintain accurate medical documentation and records of patient assessments.

Skills:  
- Proficiency in special education principles and practices.  
- Experience working with children, especially those with autism or developmental disabilities.  
- Strong knowledge of behavioral health concepts and techniques.  
- Familiarity with medical terminology related to behavioral health.  
- Ability to work effectively with individuals with developmental disabilities.  
- Excellent interpersonal skills for working with patients and their families.

Requirements:

- Certification in Behavior Analysis or related field is a plus.

Benefits:  
- Competitive salary commensurate with experience.  
- Opportunities for professional growth and development.  
- Supportive work environment that values compassion and dedication.

If you are passionate about making a positive impact on the lives of individuals with developmental disabilities and possess the necessary skills and qualifications, we invite you to apply for the position of Behavior Technician at The Lighthouse Join us in our mission to empower individuals and promote independence through evidence-based interventions.

title: Office Services Associate Floater

title: Channel Account Manager
description:
**About Envoy**
===============



Envoy's workplace platform has redefined how companies welcome visitors, improve the onsite experience, book desks and meeting rooms, manage deliveries, and access accurate and unified workplace data in 16,000 locations around the globe by designing products that solve common workplace problems.


Envoy provides a simple way to manage your complex safety, security, and compliance needs across all your workplace locations—wherever you need to bring people together.


Rely on smart, automated solutions to common workplace problems, like freeing up unused space and eliminating repetitive tasks. Not only does this allow you to make the most efficient use of your space and resources, it frees up your team's time to focus on the work that matters.


With Envoy's intuitive technology that employees actually enjoy using, you can create a great workplace experience that fosters community and togetherness by making it easy for teams to coordinate working onsite.


Unlike companies that offer disconnected workplace solutions and disparate (and often imprecise) data sources, Envoy's platform provides accurate, comprehensive, and unified workplace data so you can make informed business decisions. Envoy's integrated solutions pull data from multiple sources to ensure that you always have the most accurate data available.


For more information, visit Envoy.com.

  




**About the Role**
==================



As a Channel Account Manager you will contribute to the channel team's efforts by achieving your targets and driving results. You will prospect into target Strategic Partners as well as respond to inbound Partner requests. You will work to onboard and enable partners to generate opportunities and sell Envoy to existing and prospective customers. For this role, managing both external and internal stakeholders are important to building partner relationships and bringing partner ARR to Envoy. Internally, you will be part of a cross-functional team with sales, customer success, engineering, product and design, marketing and finance. The ideal candidate will have experience working at fast-paced start-ups and is comfortable with frequent change. Additionally, this person should have a passion for top of the funnel activities and is excited to be a member of the Envoy partnerships team.


***This is a hybrid position that requires at least 3 days a week (Tuesday - Thursday) in our New York office.***


**You will**
============


* Achieve deal registration and revenue goals through partner sourced opportunities.
* Sign, train, enable and manage new partners.
* Prospect, qualify, and engage in new partner accounts and opportunities.
* Work with partners to source new opportunities with large potential customers.
* Attend events with partners and customers to source large opportunities.
* Work with internal teams and partner teams to ensure deals progress and close.
* Work cross-functionally with sales, finance, product, marketing, and enablement.
* Build and maintain relationships with leadership at partner organizations.
* Improve the strategic process of the Envoy partnerships team.
* Travel: 25-50% with a focus on partner field engagement activities and events

**You have**
============


* 2-5 year work experience in channel sales, preferably in a SaaS company.
* Demonstrable results in channel account management.
* Familiarity with partnership agreement terms (Affiliate, Reseller and Technology).
* Carried a revenue number and influenced project/program development.
* Experience in early stage, fast growing companies.
* Strong strategic thinking, ability to develop a vision.
* Willingness to roll up your sleeves and to do what it takes to get the job done.
* Proficiency in Salesforce and marketing automation software (Ex: Outreach).
* The desire to work closely with your peers in office 3 days a week

**You are**
===========


* An exceptional writer and spoken communicator.
* Highly organized & autonomous.
* Comfortable and energized operating in a fast moving organization.
* Passionate about Envoy's products and working with Enterprise businesses.
* Entrepreneurial and self-motivated.
* Consultative with demonstrable experience.
* Enthusiastic about learning and growing at Envoy.
* Intellectually curious and ambitious.

**You'll get**
==============


* A high degree of trust in your ideas and execution
* An opportunity to partner and collaborate with other talented people
* An inclusive community where you feel welcomed and cared for as a person
* The ability to make an immediate impact helping customers create a great workplace experience
* Support for your personal and professional growth
**Compensation description**
----------------------------



Envoy's compensation package includes market competitive salary, equity for all full time roles, and great benefits. If you are located in **New York**, our expected cash compensation for this role is **$168K-$192K OTE**. Final offers may vary within the range provided based on experience, expertise, and other factors.



If you have any questions related to compensation, please contact Recruiting after you apply.


**#LI-Hybrid**

*By applying for this position, you acknowledge that you have fully read and understand the job requirements and received the Envoy Privacy Notice for applicants, which is linked* *here**. Completing this application requires you to provide personal data, such as your name and contact information, which is mandatory for Envoy to process your application. Envoy is an EEO Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of any characteristic protected by local, state or federal law.*

title: Sales Associate
description:

It is exciting times at the Inspiration Co. with over 60 stores across America and counting, we are looking for the next amazing Inspiration Nation team members to join our growing team.

The Personal Shopper (Sales Associate) is responsible for supporting the Store Manager and Assistant store-Manager aim to achieve store targets and keep the store looking presentable for our clients. We are looking for dynamic individuals, who can help our customers find the perfect bracelet for whatever season of life they are going through. Our unique bracelets are engraved with messages that inspire change, encourage faith, and ignite passion in each of us to take responsibility for our daily experience and start creating a masterpiece of our daily lives.

Our one of a kind, stunning Earth Stone Bracelets are featured in US Weekly, as one of the Top Summer Trends. We were also featured on Good Morning America and in The Grammy Awards Swag Bag!

Duties:

* Do you love talking to people?
* Are you a self-motivator?

**To be successful in this role you will need:**

* Passion to inspire every client that comes into your store

title: Busser
description:
**POSITION PURPOSE:**

We are seeking a hospitality focused and organized individual to join our team as a Bus Attendant. The Bus Attendant plays a crucial role in assisting servers or bartenders in delivering an exceptional dining experience to guests. This position is responsible for supporting front of house functions, setting, and clearing tables to provide a clean and tidy restaurant to ensure a flawless service.

**ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS AND DUTIES:**

* Maintain general cleanliness of the dining room by wiping chairs and tables to ensure a clean and presentable dining experience for guests.
* Set tables with the proper silverware, dishware, linen, and glasses for service.
* Stock and restock any side-stations with necessary supplies as instructed, ensuring a smooth service.
* Clears and resets tables during service to establish a seamless service flow.
* Deliver, fill, and re-fill water as requested by guests and/or directed by servers.
* Anticipate and accommodate the needs of the guests.
* Helps ensure guest satisfaction through active participation in service.
* Report all breakage and damage of equipment or furniture immediately to management.
* Attend and participate in daily pre-service meetings and any training sessions or departmental meetings.
* Follow proper opening or closing procedures, ensuring a clean and welcoming dining room.
* Assist the team and provide help or support to deliver a memorable guest experience.
* Complete other tasks as instructed by managers.

**KNOWLEDGE, EXPERIENCE AND SKILLS**

* High school diploma or equivalent is preferred.
* Additional training or certification in food service, hospitality, or sommelier studies preferred.
* Previous experience as a busser in fine dining or upscale restaurant settings.
* Extensive knowledge of fine dining etiquette, service procedures, and wine service.
* Strong interpersonal skills, with the ability to communicate effectively and professionally with guests, colleagues, and management.
* Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail, with the ability to multitask and prioritize tasks in a fast-paced environment.
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team, demonstrating reliability, flexibility, and a positive attitude.
* Proficiency in basic computer skills, including knowledge of scheduling software and point-of-sale systems.
* Flexibility to work a variety of shifts, including evenings, weekends, and holidays as required.
* Commitment to upholding the highest standards of customer service, professionalism, and integrity.

**PHYSICAL ACTIVITIES AND REQUIREMENTS OF THIS POSITION:**

* Ability to stand for extended periods and work in a fast-paced environment.
* Endurance to withstand long hours of standing, walking, and repetitive motions.
* Lift and carry objects weighing up to 50 pounds.
* Flexibility to bend, stoop, reach, and perform physical tasks.
* Adherence to proper lifting techniques and ergonomics to prevent strain or injury while performing job duties.

**INTENT AND FUNCTION OF JOB DESCRIPTIONS**

All descriptions have been reviewed to ensure that only essential functions and basic duties have been included. Peripheral tasks, only incidentally related to each position, have been excluded.  Requirements, skills, and abilities included have been determined to be the minimal standards required to successfully perform the positions. In no instance, however, should the duties, responsibilities, and requirements delineated be interpreted as all-inclusive.  Additional functions and requirements may be assigned by supervisors as deemed appropriate. Job descriptions are not intended as and do not create employment contracts.  The organization maintains its status as an at-will employer.

***Cipriani is an equal opportunity employer.***

* Paid time off

title: Medicaid Coordinator - Temporary

Stay informed about changes in Medicaid policies and procedures.

* **Eligibility Determination:**
* Work closely with residents, their families, and relevant staff to assess Medicaid eligibility.
* Collaborate with external agencies and Medicaid representatives to resolve any issues or discrepancies.
* **Documentation and Record Keeping:**
* Maintain organized and up-to-date records of all Medicaid applications and related documents.
* Provide regular updates to the management team regarding the status of Medicaid applications.
* **Education and Guidance:**
* Educate residents and their families on the Medicaid application process, eligibility criteria and patient financial responsibility.
* Offer guidance and support to address any questions or concerns related to Medicaid.
* **Collaboration with Healthcare Providers:**
* Coordinate with healthcare providers and internal staff to gather necessary medical information for Medicaid applications.
* Foster positive relationships with external agencies to streamline the application process.
* **Compliance:**
* Ensure compliance with all federal and state regulations pertaining to Medicaid applications.
* Stay abreast of changes in legislation and implement necessary adjustments to processes.

**Qualifications:**

* Over a year experience in Medicaid application processing within a healthcare or nursing home setting.
* Strong knowledge of Medicaid regulations and policies.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Detail-oriented with exceptional organizational abilities.

title: Automotive Store Managers
description:
**Mavis Tires & Brakes at Discount Prices - Automotive Store Managers**

  

Put your career into high gear with Mavis Tires & Brakes at Discount Prices! We're looking for full-time Automotive Store Managers to join Team Mavis at one of our state-of-the-art automotive service and retail tire sales centers in the **Peekskill, NY** area. With over 2,000 retail locations, Mavis is one of the largest tire sales and automotive repair chains in the United States.


**About the Position of Automotive Store Manager**


Automotive Store Managers are responsible for the management of a retail store location and ensuring maximum profitability by driving sales, monitoring inventory and expenses, managing personnel and controlling operating costs. In addition to implementing and managing sales programs, our Store Managers direct the work of technicians and mechanics to ensure the timely and safe completion of high-quality vehicle repair and maintenance. To advance Mavis's sales initiatives, Store Managers communicate directly with customers, assess customer needs, provide information regarding requested and/or necessary automotive repairs and maintenance and ensure complete customer satisfaction. With our revolutionary digital dashboard, Store Managers can track their personal success and watch their weekly earnings grow as grow they lead by example to reinforce Mavis's position as the premiere tire and auto service retailer.


**Employee Benefits**


At Mavis, we understand that our people drive our success. We provide our team members with competitive weekly pay, including weekly incentive compensation, a good working environment and an excellent combination of additional benefits like health, dental and vision insurance, a 401(k) retirement savings plan with employer match, paid vacations, paid time off, paid holidays, life insurance, on-the-job training, and opportunities for career growth and advancement.

**Qualifications**


We recruit team members who share our commitment to providing complete customer satisfaction and delivering the highest quality service. To be eligible for the position of Automotive Store Manager, you must (1) be at least 18 years of age; (2) be legally authorized to work in the United States; and (3) possess 1 year of experience in retail store management or any combination of education, training and experience which demonstrates the ability to perform the duties and responsibilities of the position.  



  

What are you waiting for? **APPLY NOW!**


Candidates can apply online at www.mavis.com/careers. **OPEN INTERVIEWS ARE AVAILABLE 7 DAYS A WEEK!** Simply walk in during store hours for an immediate interview. If you have any additional questions, you may call the Recruitment department toll-free # at 844-375-3995.


For more information about Mavis, please visit www.mavis.com.

 ***Mavis is an Equal Opportunity Employer***

*Consistent with our commitment to the principal of equal employment opportunity for all individuals, we enforce a zero tolerance policy on discrimination at Mavis. Employment decisions are made without regard to an applicant's or employee's actual or perceived membership in any category or status protected by applicable federal, state, or local law. The physical demands described above are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of the position. Where appropriate, Mavis may provide reasonable accommodation, in order for an otherwise qualified individual to perform the essential functions of the position.*

*Mavis does not seek salary history information from applicants.*

title: Registered Nurse (RN), Sub acute, FT Nights
description:
Waveny LifeCare Network is currently looking to hire a Registered Nurse (RN) for our skilled nursing facility. This is a full-time, benefit eligible position. This position provides professional, quality resident care in an environment which is safe, pleasant and therapeutic. The role also practices nursing care based on sound medical knowledge and nursing skills. Responsibilities will include but are not limited to:

* Provides quality resident care providing assessment, formulating, implementing and evaluating resident care plans.
* Implements resident care according to the medical/nursing care plans assuring sound, accurate and comprehensive care is delivered to each resident
* Gives medications as ordered by the physician in accordance with Waveny LifeCare Network policy assuring residents receive the correct medications and doses while understanding all aspects of medications
* Administers or assists with treatments as ordered or performed by the physician
* Has knowledge of residents’ conditions at all times reporting changes to the appropriate discipline recognizing all physical and psychological conditions.
* Acts as a charge nurse as assigned assuming 8-hour responsibility to recognize and meet residents’ medical/nursing care needs.
* Acts as liaison between resident, family and physician providing continuity of care recognizing the family’s understanding of physician’s orders.
* Performs direct resident care as assigned
* Assures resident education of care plans having residents understand good health habits, special procedures, understanding of diagnosis, medications and discharge planning, if applicable.
* Maintains open communications with members of the interdisciplinary healthcare team.
* Documents on charts accurately, objectively and timely, reflecting problems, approaches, measurable goals and time frames of resident care.
* Communicates appropriate information (personnel problems and residents” conditions) to Nurse Supervisor and Nurse Manager assuring the meeting of physical, social, psychological and spiritual needs of the resident.
* Approaches interpersonal relationships in a manner which avoids antagonism and reduces conflict.
* Assures and maintains a safe and infection free resident environment.
* Recognizes safety hazards and acts upon them appropriately.
* Assures equipment is in good working order and reports any unsafe equipment to Environmental Services immediately.
* Remains knowledgeable in emergency situations and uses equipment, documents and communicates appropriately.
* Recognizes potential infection control problem areas and maintains accountability for adherence to infection control procedures.
* Exercises good judgment in using proper body mechanics to prevent injury to self and others.
* Acts as a role model and assumes a leadership role as designated. **Sets an example by displaying positive qualities and attitudes**
* Provides direction and support to CNAs and other licensed personnel in the implementation of resident care
* Institutes and maintains a cooperative team effort among staff members
* Assists in the training and teaching of CNAs’ required skills
* Reorganizes assignments, as needed, to deal with unexpected changes without comprising resident care
* Continually upgrades and makes changes in job area to assure professional growth and development and that the department meets the needs of the changing market/field.
* Supports, promotes, and projects guest relations and positive images to all visitors, residents, and other Waveny LifeCare Network personnel

Qualification for this role:

Requires a registered nurse licensed in the State of Connecticut. Must have excellent interpersonal skills and the ability to work with all levels of people diplomatically and tactfully. Requires the ability to be sensitive to the aging population recognizing geriatric needs. Experience in long-term care required. Licensed staff must have the ability to perform lifting and other strenuous duties.

Waveny LifeCare Network is an Equal Opportunity Employer

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

* Dental insurance
* Flexible spending account
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Referral program
* Tuition reimbursement
* Vision insurance

Medical Specialty:

* Geriatrics

Physical Setting:

* Long term care

Experience:

* RN: 2 years (Preferred)
* Long term acute care: 1 year (Preferred)
* Supervising: 1 year (Required)

License/Certification:

* BLS Certification (Preferred)
* RN license (Required)

title: Head of Legal Operations
description:
Circle is a financial technology company at the epicenter of the emerging internet of money, where value can finally travel like other digital data — globally, nearly instantly and less expensively than legacy settlement systems. This ground-breaking new internet layer opens up previously unimaginable possibilities for payments, commerce and markets that can help raise global economic prosperity and enhance inclusion. Our infrastructure – including USDC, a blockchain-based dollar – helps businesses, institutions and developers harness these breakthroughs and capitalize on this major turning point in the evolution of money and technology.


**What you'll be part of:**



Circle is committed to visibility and stability in everything we do. As we grow as an organization, we're expanding into some of the world's strongest jurisdictions. Speed and efficiency are motivators for our success and our employees live by our company values: Multistakeholder, Mindfulness, Driven by Excellence and High Integrity. Circlers are consistently evolving in a remote world where strength in numbers fuels team success. We have built a flexible and diverse work environment where new ideas are encouraged and everyone is a stakeholder.

**What you'll be responsible for:**



Under the direction of the Deputy General Counsel, Corporate, you will play an immediate and direct role supporting legal operations needs of Circle Legal's Corporate pillar, which includes Transactions and Corporate Governance teams.


**What you'll work on:**


* Oversee the development, implementation, or improvement of processes, procedures and metrics to increase the overall effectiveness of the legal services provided by the Corporate Legal teams.
* Board Support and Entity Management
* Legal Analytics: Analyze and provide insights that support strategic decision-making; Track contract and legal requests, provide reporting on response times, volumes, and approvals.
* Process Improvement: Develop, implement, and maintain processes and systems to improve the efficiency of the Corporate legal teams.
* Technology Management: Identify, implement, integrate, and manage legal technology solutions to streamline operations, such as contract management systems, e-billing, and document management systems.
* Data Analysis and Reporting: Collect and analyze data to provide insights and reports on team performance and metrics.
* Project Management: Manage legal projects from inception to completion.
* Team Oversight: Grow and manage a legal operations team as demand requires, to ensure engagement and coordination across the Legal team and other internal stakeholders.


**You will aspire to our four core values:**


* **Multistakeholder -** you have dedication and commitment to our customers, shareholders, employees and families and local communities.
* **Mindful -** you seek to be respectful, an active listener and to pay attention to detail.
* **Driven by Excellence -** you are driven by our mission and our passion for customer success which means you relentlessly pursue excellence, that you do not tolerate mediocrity and you work intensely to achieve your goals.
* **High Integrity -** you seek open and honest communication, and you hold yourself to very high moral and ethical standards. You reject manipulation, dishonesty and intolerance.


**What you'll bring to Circle:**


* 10+ years of practical, hands-on experience managing legal operations teams and activities that support a large, in-house legal organization.
* 3+ years of managing high-performing teams.
* Experience collaborating across cross-functional teams through system integration and continuous process improvement.
* Experience across legal technology product platforms including but not limited to board collaboration, contract management, vendor management, and e-billing systems.
* You are a team player with a sense of humor, and enjoy learning but also mentoring.
* You are comfortable working in an evolving and growing environment that is prone to changes, and managing multiple projects simultaneously and you have a "no-job-is-too-small" attitude.
* You apply sound, practical business judgment to your recommendations, and are creative at solving problems.
* You can work autonomously and independently with guidance but are also comfortable working collaboratively as part of a team.
* Proficiency in Google Suite, Slack and Apple MacOS preferred.


**Additional Information:**


* This position is eligible for day-one PERM sponsorship for qualified candidates.


*Circle is on a mission to create an inclusive financial future, with transparency at our core. We consider a wide variety of elements when crafting our compensation ranges and total compensation packages.*


*Starting pay is determined by various factors, including but not limited to: relevant experience, skill set, qualifications, and other business and organizational needs. Please note that compensation ranges may differ for candidates in other locations.*


*Base Pay Range: $162,500 - $212,500*


*Annual Bonus Target: 17.5%*


*Also Included: Equity & Benefits (including medical, dental, vision and 401(k)). Circle has a discretionary vacation policy. We also provide 10 days of paid sick leave per year and 11 paid holidays per year in the U.S.*


We are an **equal opportunity employer** and value diversity at Circle. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Additionally, Circle participates in the **E-Verify Program** in certain locations, as required by law.


###### 
#LI-Remote

title: Home Health Aide (HHA) Part Time
description:
*Fox Trail Memory Care Living (MCL)*, New Jersey's largest provider of residential Alzheimer's & Dementia care, was founded on the belief that every person deserves a life of rich engagement, meaningful experiences, and dignity regardless of age or cognitive state. Our premier programming allows each person to find relevance and meaning in their daily lives. We pride ourselves on the fact that our level of care is second to none. We have an unparalleled care partner to resident ratio, with a maximum capacity of only 16 residents per home. We contribute to quality of life through socialization, companionship, and purposeful activity. We are also growing at an extremely fast rate, creating exciting and rewarding career opportunities within. We are looking for the next generation of leaders to help take Fox Trail MCL to the next level!


*Fox Trail Memory Care Living (MCL)* is seeking an enthusiastic and motivated individual to join our team as a **Home Health Aide (HHA)**. HHA's are Care Partners for us. Care Partners are the heart and soul of our homes. The Home Health Aide is responsible for providing the highest degree of quality care and services to the residents (and their families) in our intimate home-like settings. The HHA is expected to spend the necessary time to fully understand the unique needs of our residents so that we can provide better care to those we serve than any competitor. At *Fox Trail MCL*, we go above and beyond the call of duty to make sure that our residents have the highest level of service we can possibly offer. In order to fit in with our culture, your core values should be consistent with ours in terms of service level.


**Roles and Responsibilities:**

* Build meaningful relationships with our residents and their families as you provide assistance with activities of daily living
* Attend to individual care needs and get to know residents' unique preferences and personalities
* Attend to the individual needs of residents, which may include assistance with grooming, bathing, oral hygiene, feeding, incontinent care, toileting, prosthetic appliances, transferring, ambulation, range of motion, communicating, or other needs in keeping with the individuals' care requirements
* Knowledge of the individualized wellness plan for residents and provide support to the residents according to their care plan. Contribute to the care planning process by providing the house with specific information and observations of the residents' needs and preferences
* Maintain the comfort, privacy, and dignity of residents in the delivery of services to them.
* Interact with residents in a manner that displays warmth and promotes a caring environment
* Follow the directions of management and work as a positive team member of the Care Partner team (while using Fox Trail MCL's strategy guides for success)
* Work as a team to create meaningful activities for the residents
* Assist in maintaining a safe, neat and clean environment
* Promote a homelike environment for residents
* Cook healthy meals in conjunction with the menu

**Required Skills and Experience:**

* Dedication to and passion to serve seniors with excellent customer service skills
* Flexibility and a willingness to modify role duties for the overall good of the community
* High School diploma/GED
* State Required Certification or License for the position you are seeking
* Must be at least 18 years of age
* Previous experience working with seniors preferred
* Ability to make decisions and act in the resident's best interest
* Possess written and verbal skills for effective communication and a level of understanding
* Competent in organizational and time management skills
* Demonstrate good judgment, problem solving and decision-making skills
* Must be willing able to lift over 75 pounds (i.e. transferring of residents)


This position is available for Part-Time, Per Diem. 7AM-3PM, 3pm-11pm, 11PM-7AM

title: National Account Manager
description:
Parsippany, NJ

**Highlight Motor Freight** is one of the largest and fastest growing transportation companies in North America. As a result of our driven marketing approach and second-to-none work ethic, we are experiencing tremendous growth. In order to keep up with our growth we will be seeking experienced, professional, energetic, goal-oriented individuals to complement our organization.

**Highlight Motor Freight** offers an exciting, fast-paced environment that has ideal positions for someone who is looking for a **REAL** career move. To work for **Highlight Motor Freight** you must have great people skills, communicate well, have a team oriented personality, and have the desire to set and achieve goals. As our company is constantly expanding, we are looking for those candidates who are highly motivated and driven by the opportunity for financial reward and career advancement in the family like working environment.

**Job Description:**

We are looking for a high-performing **National Account Manager** who will be responsible for achieving sales and gross margin objectives and help us meet acquisition and revenue growth targets by keeping our company competitive and innovative.

**Responsibilities:**

* Determine annual unit and gross-profit plans by implementing marketing strategies.
* Achieve Sales and Gross Profit objectives, as well as other defined KPI’s, for the Year.
* Design and implement a strategic business plan that expands the company’s customer base and ensures its strong presence.
* Develop a database of qualified leads through referrals, telephone canvassing, face to face cold calling on business owners, by email, and networking.
* Build and promote strong, long-lasting customer relationships by partnering with them, understanding their needs and ensuring a continued high level of service is provided.
* Working with all the appropriate members to ensure each existing or potential client receives timely accurate quotes and all the support information that enables the client to make their decisions in a timely and cost-effective manner.
* Present sales, revenue and expenses reports and realistic forecasts to the management team.
* Identify emerging markets and market shifts while being fully aware of new products and competition status.
* Manage daily functioning of all new client relationships.
* Develop and promote strategic, bespoke solutions to generate new business opportunities.
* Train, coach and set objectives, monitor performance of sales team to ensure that assigned tasks and responsibilities are fulfilled.

**Requirements:**

* Minimum 3 years of sales manager experience in transportation industry
* Outstanding closing deals skills
* Strong organizational and tactical skills to prioritize and manage and achieve Sales Targets
* Good interpersonal skills with the ability to work in a team-based approach and develop excellent relationships with customers.
* Demonstrate high personal integrity and be willing to take responsibility for achieving annual sales and gross margin objectives.
* Extensive knowledge of Transportation/Logistics industry and the key target markets
* Superior customer relation skills, excellent oral, written and interpersonal communication skills with the ability to contribute support and enhance the team.
* Strong understanding of customer and market dynamics and requirements
* Computer knowledge – working knowledge of Microsoft Office applications
* Proven track record of sales.

**We offer market competitive wages with great benefits package.**

title: Medical Office Manager (Mental Health)
description:
**PAX Health** is a leading mental and behavioral health organization dedicated to providing comprehensive and compassionate care to individuals facing mental health challenges. Our team of professionals strive to create an environment where mental health is prioritized, stigma is eradicated, and individuals can thrive in their journey towards well-being.

**PAX Health** is seeking a highly motivated and experienced **Office Manager** to join our dynamic team. The **Office Manager** will be responsible for overseeing daily administrative functions, optimizing workflows, and ensuring a seamless experience for both patients and staff.

**Responsibilities:**

* Manage and coordinate all aspects of daily operations within the healthcare practice, including scheduling, patient flow, and staff assignments.
* Provide leadership and direction to office staff, including training and performance management.
* Ensure staff members adhere to policies and procedures and deliver excellent customer service.
* Assist with various administrative tasks such as phone answering, mail sorting, and document preparation.
* Oversee the maintenance of the electronic health records system, including data entry, documentation, and confidentiality protocols.
* Develop and implement processes to continuously improve the quality of patient care and enhance the overall patient experience.
* Identify opportunities to streamline processes and improve efficiency within the practice.
* Track and analyze key performance indicators to assess the effectiveness of operations, identify areas for improvement, and ensure alignment with organizational goals.
* Assist with recruitment initiatives and supervise the onboarding process for new employees.
* Schedule clients and staff appointments, ensuring accurate and up-to-date schedules.
* Communicate with insurance companies regarding patient care and billing.
* Maintain office equipment by coordinating cleaning, maintenance, and repairs.
* Collaborate cross functionally to facilitate:
* Financial operations, including billing, accounts receivable, and revenue cycle management.
* Serving as the contact person for all clinicians, addressing any issues that may arise.
* The coordination of credentialing processes for clinical staff.
* Serving as a liaison between attorneys and the organization.
* Acting as a contact person for sublets and managing conflict resolution between providers and claimants.

**Qualifications:**

* High school diploma or equivalent required; Associate degree in office administration or related field preferred.
* At least three years of administrative and clerical experience required.
* Ability to type at least 60 words per minute.
* Extensive knowledge of office management procedures.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
* Excellent interpersonal and customer service skills.
* Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.
* Excellent time management skills with a proven ability to meet deadlines.
* Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite or related software.
* Prolonged periods sitting at a desk and working on a computer.
* Must be able to lift up to 15 pounds at times.
* **Salary range is $60K-$70K based on experience.**

title: Business Development Manager
description:
Parsippany, NJ

**Highlight Motor Freight** is one of the largest and fastest growing transportation companies in North America. As a result of our driven marketing approach and second-to-none work ethic, we are experiencing tremendous growth. In order to keep up with our growth we will be seeking experienced, professional, energetic, goal-oriented individuals to complement our organization.

**Highlight Motor Freight** offers an exciting, fast-paced environment that has ideal positions for someone who is looking for a **REAL** career move. To work for **Highlight Motor Freight** you must have great people skills, communicate well, have a team oriented personality, and have the desire to set and achieve goals. As our company is constantly expanding, we are looking for those candidates who are highly motivated and driven by the opportunity for financial reward and career advancement in the family like working environment.

**Job Description:**

We are looking for a highly motivated and energetic **Business Development Manager** who will establish potential client’s base by contacting prospective clients and expanding business with current clients. **Business Development Manager** will be developing strategic plans and marketing programs to increase company’s revenues and profitability.

**What We Offer:**

* **UNLIMITED POTENTIAL INCOME**
* **ABOVE INDUSTRY AVERAGE SALARY AND BONUS STRUCTURE**
* **CAR AND CELL PHONE ALLOWANCE**
* **COMPANY PAID BENEFITS PACKAGE**
* **GREAT WORKING CONDITIONS**
* **MORE THAN 500 TRUCKS ON THE ROAD TO SUPPORT YOUR CLIENTS 24/7**

**Responsibilities:**

* Responsible for effectively securing new customers and account acquisitions as well as maintaining and developing existing accounts.
* Promote the services and products of all entities and coordinate sales efforts with other department sales.
* Analyze and conduct research on potential clients that have a need for our services and educate customers about our shipping solutions.
* Generate leads through cold calling, networking and referrals.
* Ensure a high level of customer satisfaction- maintain close contact with all customers– including follow up on concerns or other issues.
* Execute and monitor strategic and tactical goals to maximize sales, profit and to ensure sales targets are met or exceeded.
* Consults and develops strategies with potential customers through phone, virtual, and in-person meetings on transportation.
* Develop, facilitate and negotiate the proposal pricing process and rate agreements to customers.
* Meet and exceed target set in terms of contributing and generating revenue for the department.
* Provide documented activity reports of your sales efforts on a daily, weekly and monthly basis.

**Requirements:**

title: Human Resources Assistant
description:
Job Summary:  
We are seeking a highly motivated and organized Human Resources Assistant to support our HR department. The ideal candidate will be responsible for providing administrative support to our HR team and assist in various HR functions. This role will involve working closely with HR staff to ensure the smooth operation of HR processes. This is an excellent opportunity to develop your skills in HR and contribute to a dynamic organization.

Duties:

- Assist with recruitment and hiring processes, including scheduling interviews and maintaining applicant tracking systems.  
- Provide support for employee onboarding, including creating new hire packets and conducting orientation sessions.

- Ability to maintain confidentiality and handle sensitive information with discretion.
